page.title: 01Sharlston and Crofton
page.content: Sharlston and Crofton are villages on the outskirts of Wakefield. Both are close to the main roads to Doncaster and Pontefract and are largely residential, with most people travelling out of the area to work and shop. Housing is a mixture of council-owned and private, with some modern, some terraced and some very old buildings such as Sharlston Hall. Although surrounded by farmland the main employer is probably the N.C.B. Each village has coal mines nearby and this often means houses suffer from subsidence. Entertainment is provided by pubs and clubs. There is also a strong sporting tradition, particularly with regard to Rugby League.
